summary.para: Defines constants that specify types of notifications raised by or objects.
You can register and unregister for these notifications by calling and , respectively.
This notification is raised by an object when the adapter list becomes stale. The fresh-to-stale transition is one-way, and one-time, so this notification is raised at most one time.
This notification is raised by an object when the adapter becomes no longer valid. The valid-to-invalid transition is one-way, and one-time, so this notification is raised at most one time.

This notification is raised by an object when an adapter budget change occurs. This notification can occur many times. Using this notification is functionally similar to . In response to this event, you should call (with ) to evaluate the current memory budget state.

This notification is raised by an object to notify of an adapter's hardware content protection teardown. This notification can occur many times. It is functionally similar to . In response to this event, you should re-evaluate the current crypto session status; for example, by calling to determine the impact of the hardware teardown for a specific interface.
